sentences.en: After the Second World War the franchise was extended to all adults over eighteen.
sentences.cn: 二战之后,选举权的范围扩大到所有18岁以上的成人.

sentences.en: Catering in the schools is run on a franchise basis.
sentences.cn: 学校餐饮服务以特许权经营.

sentences.en: Direct main chains, franchise chains and other types of freedom.
sentences.cn: 主要有直营连锁 、 特许连锁、自由连锁等类型.

sentences.en: Franchise grew up quick and performance obvious in our country.
sentences.cn: 特许经营模式在我国商业经营中成长迅速,效益明显.

sentences.en: He runs his sandwich chain as a franchise operation.
sentences.cn: 作为一种给予特许专营权业务,他经营三明治连锁店.

sentences.en: His sandwich bar is so successful that he decided to franchise it.
sentences.cn: 他的三明治酒吧很成功,他决定出售其专营权.

sentences.en: If there is a good brand franchise can do, better reputation.
sentences.cn: 如果有好的品牌加盟店也行, 信誉要好.

sentences.en: Intangible assets include goodwill, patents, trademarks, copyrights, and franchise.
sentences.cn: 无形资产包括商誉 、 专利权 、 商标 、 版权, 以及专营权.

sentences.en: She has recently franchised her business.
sentences.cn: 她最近已出售了其公司的特许经营权。

sentences.en: Talk to other franchise holders and ask them what they think of the parent company.
sentences.cn: 和其他特许经营者谈一谈，问问他们对母公司是什么看法。

sentences.en: The Diet is chosen under a franchise that is universal for citizens aged twenty - one and over.
sentences.cn: 国会由年满 二十一 岁以上的公民普遍选举产生.

sentences.en: The diving school has acquired a franchise for scuba equipment.
sentences.cn: 潜水学校获得潜水用水肺的特许经营权.

sentences.en: The minimum start-up capital for a Pizza franchise is estimated at $250,000 to $315,000.
sentences.cn: 申请比萨饼店的品牌特许经营权的最低启动资金估计为25万到31.5万美元。

sentences.en: There's a recognition that a game's quality can impact the overall franchise.
sentences.cn: 这以一种共识,一部游戏的质量会影响到整体的经营.

sentences.en: They were given the franchise a few years ago.
sentences.cn: 数年前他们获得选举权.

sentences.en: We all know what a franchise is, we see them every day.
sentences.cn: 我们都知道连锁店是什麽, 每天也都看得到它们.

words.tran_cn: [贸易]特权；公民权；经销权；管辖权
给…以特许（或特权）；赋予公民权

trans.tran_cn: 选举权，参政权，特许权，经销权
trans.tran_en: permission given by a company to someone who wants to sell its goods or services

trans.tran_cn: 给…以特许（或特权）；赋予公民权
trans.tran_en: to give or sell a franchise to someone
to give or sell a franchise to someone
